content.question: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. Nunc media Aenean secum per moenia ducit, Sidoniasque ostentat opes urbemque paratam: incipit effari, mediaque in voce resistit;. nunc eadem, labente die, convivia quaerit, (5) Iliacosque iterum demens audire labores exposcit, pendetque iterum narrantis ab ore. 1. Name the person who is the subject of ducit (line 1) and ostentat (line 2).

frqParts.text: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. Nunc media Aenean secum per moenia ducit, Sidoniasque ostentat opes urbemque paratam: incipit effari, mediaque in voce resistit;. nunc eadem, labente die, convivia quaerit, (5) Iliacosque iterum demens audire labores exposcit, pendetque iterum narrantis ab ore. 1. Name the person who is the subject of ducit (line 1) and ostentat (line 2).
2. Describe two specific actions from lines 4-6 that reveal this person's state of mind. Refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer.
3. In Book 8 of the Aeneid, Aeneas is taken on a tour of Pallanteum. Describe specifically the significance of Pallanteum in the Aeneid.

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
